intro: Streptocalyx pallidus, commonly known as the pale streptocalyx, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
